references.paper_title: U-net: Convolutional networks for biomedical image segmentation
references.reason: This paper introduces the U-Net architecture, a fundamental model in biomedical image segmentation that is extensively used and adapted in the current work.

references.paper_title: Fully convolutional networks for semantic segmentation
references.reason: This work is foundational to many semantic segmentation methods, and its fully convolutional architecture is essential to the current research.
This paper introduces the Mask R-CNN model which provides a powerful method for instance segmentation, and its region of interest (ROI) pooling is used in the current work.
This paper introduces the Deformable DETR model, a transformer-based object detection model, which the current research adapts for graph prediction.

references.paper_title: cldice—a novel topology-preserving loss function for tubular structure segmentation
references.reason: This paper introduces a new loss function that directly addresses topological accuracy, which is a major focus of the current research.
